answers.answer: Welcome to the gastroenterology community!  Do you have any of the risk factors for high blood pressure (overweight, stress, etc.)?

Do you have overweight , diabetes , stress , etc ?I advice ya to make a schedule consists of 3 columns & 3 Rows (3 days x 3 blood pressure readings) and just observe it during this three days , then we will decide how much worse are it!added to that , I advice ya to take some anti-Acid drugs for short and temporary therapy.and don't forget avoiding some food which may make irritation and increase acid in stomach , like : (anything fried, spices, food with high amount of fat, Coca-cola , etc.)Finally, re-do H.pylori test to confirm that it's gone to hell.with Best Regards: pharmacist : Scorpion :)

question: I am 56 years old, since the beginning of January 2012 I have been experiencing high blood pressure. After  a month we found out I had H. Pylori bacteria and acid reflux.  I was on antibiotics for 14 days and as I am trying to recover, I still have occupational pain at the bottom of my esophagus and Upper abdominal pain and discomfort, and it also would raise my blood pressure.  Last night I drank some diluted prune juice to help with constipation, and it made the mater worse.  Please advise on what I should be doing and what I should ask my doctor to test for, specially with blood pressure.Thanks,Alex A.
title: Acid reflux and high blood pressure
